intro: Diplotaxis erucoides, commonly known as the African cabbages or false mustard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a taproot and upright, branching stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from spring to summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Diplotaxis erucoides is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in regions with low rainfall.
